intro: Erigeron welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
